original: @265a # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @265a # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: m'a r'i tsyee de w'i s'a dha nam /
analyzed: m'a r'i tsyee de w'i s'a dha nam /
translated: Marīcīdevīsādhana

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: lha mo 'od zer can gyi sgrub thabs /
analyzed: lha mo 'od zer can gyi sgrub thabs /
translated: Goddess Marīcī’s Sādhana

original: lha mo 'od zer can la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: lha mo 'od zer can la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the goddess Marīcī.

original: de la dang por re zhig nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bsams la /
analyzed: de la dang por re zhig nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bsams la /
translated: First, visualize the sun maṇḍala.

original: de'i steng du sa bon lnga pa'i lnga pa la /
analyzed: de'i steng du sa bon lnga pa'i lnga pa la /
translated: On top of that, visualize the fifth of the fifth seed syllable,

original: dang po'i gnyis pa rdzogs par byas la /
analyzed: dang po'i gnyis pa rdzogs par byas la /
translated: the second of the first completed,

original: zla ba phyed pa dang thig les brgyan pa bsams la /
analyzed: zla ba phyed pa dang thig les brgyan pa bsams la /
translated: adorned with a half-moon and a drop.

original: de las byung ba'i lha mo 'od zer can sku mdog dmar ba /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i lha mo 'od zer can sku mdog dmar ba /
translated: From that, visualize the goddess Marīcī, red in color,

original: zhal drug pa zhal dang po dmar po /
analyzed: zhal drug pa zhal dang po dmar po /
translated: with six faces—the first face is red,

original: gnyis pa nag po /
analyzed: gnyis pa nag po /
translated: the second is black,

original: gsum pa ljang gu /
analyzed: gsum pa ljang gu /
translated: the third is green,

original: bzhi pa ser po /
analyzed: bzhi pa ser po /
translated: the fourth is yellow,

original: lnga pa dkar po /
analyzed: lnga pa dkar po /
translated: the fifth is white,

original: steng gi dbu phag gdong nag po /
analyzed: steng gi dbu phag gdong nag po /
translated: and the upper face is a black pig’s face.

original: aa shva ka dang mchod rten gyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: aa shva ka dang mchod rten gyis brgyan pa /
translated: She is adorned with aśoka trees and stūpas,

original: gsus khyim che ba thod pa'i phreng ba can dbu skra dmar ser gyen du brdzes pa /
analyzed: gsus khyim che ba thod pa'i phreng ba can dbu skra dmar ser gyen du brdzes pa /
translated: has a large belly, a garland of skulls, and orange hair standing upward.

original: sbrul gyi zhags pa stag lpags kyi sham thabs bsnams pa /
analyzed: sbrul gyi zhags pa stag lpags kyi sham thabs bsnams pa /
translated: He holds a snake-lasso and a tiger-skin skirt.

original: bgegs rnams ltung bar mdzad pa /
analyzed: bgegs rnams ltung bar mdzad pa /
translated: He causes obstacles to fall.

original: kha dog sna tshogs pa'i phag gi shing rta la g-yon brkyang bas bzhugs pa /
analyzed: kha dog sna tshogs pa'i phag gi shing rta la g-yon brkyang bas bzhugs pa /
translated: He stands with his left leg extended on a multicolored pig chariot.

original: phyag g-yas na ral gri dang / rdo rje dang gtun shing dang mda' dang rdo rje rtse gcig pa dang dgra sta bsnams pa /
analyzed: phyag g-yas na ral gri dang / rdo rje dang gtun shing dang mda' dang rdo rje rtse gcig pa dang dgra sta bsnams pa /
translated: In his right hands he holds a sword, a vajra, a pestle, an arrow, a single-pronged vajra, and a battle-ax.

original: g-yon na sdigs mdzub zhags pa dang bcas pa dang / thod pa dang aa shva ka'i zhags pa dang / tshangs pa'i mgo bo dang / gzhu dang tri sh'u la bsnams pa /
analyzed: g-yon na sdigs mdzub zhags pa dang bcas pa dang / thod pa dang aa shva ka'i zhags pa dang / tshangs pa'i mgo bo dang / gzhu dang tri sh'u la bsnams pa /
translated: In his left hands he holds a threatening gesture with a lasso, a skull cup, an aśoka-branch lasso, a head of Brahmā, a bow, and a trident.

original: spyan gsum par bsam mo //
analyzed: spyan gsum par bsam mo //
translated: He is imagined to have three eyes.

original: mdun du shing zlum po'i dbus su lag pa gnyis pa sdigs mdzub bsgreng bar bsams la /
analyzed: mdun du shing zlum po'i dbus su lag pa gnyis pa sdigs mdzub bsgreng bar bsams la /
translated: In front of him, in the center of a round tree, he imagines a two-armed [form of himself] with a threatening gesture raised.

original: bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das yum 'od zer can yin no zhes nga rgyal bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das yum 'od zer can yin no zhes nga rgyal bskyed par bya'o //
translated: He should generate the pride, “I am the Blessed Lady Mārīcī.”

original: de nas phyag rgya bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas phyag rgya bcing bar bya'o //
translated: Then he should bind the consort.

original: rdo rje thal mo kha sbyar la gung mo gnyis gshibs la myu gur bya ste mthe bo gnyis skyil krung du bsnol la /
analyzed: rdo rje thal mo kha sbyar la gung mo gnyis gshibs la myu gur bya ste mthe bo gnyis skyil krung du bsnol la /
translated: The vajra palms are joined together, the two middle fingers are placed side by side and made into a sprout, and the two thumbs are crossed in a binding.

original: mdzub mo gnyis rtse mo dgug par bya'o //
analyzed: mdzub mo gnyis rtse mo dgug par bya'o //
translated: The two index fingers should be bent at the tips.

original: de nas bzlas pa'i sngags ni aom m'a r'i tsyee m'am h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: de nas bzlas pa'i sngags ni aom m'a r'i tsyee m'am h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /
translated: Then the mantra for the recitation is: Oṃ māri cye māṃ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ svāhā.

original: lha mo 'od zer can gyi sgrub pa'i thabs rdzogs so //
analyzed: lha mo 'od zer can gyi sgrub pa'i thabs rdzogs so //
translated: The sādhana of the goddess Marīcī is complete.

original: slob dpon chen po phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub brnyes pa dri ma med pa'i lhas mdzad pa'i sgrub thabs bcu gcig rdzogs so//
analyzed: slob dpon chen po phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub brnyes pa dri ma med pa'i lhas mdzad pa'i sgrub thabs bcu gcig rdzogs so//
translated: The eleven sādhanas composed by the great master Vimalaprabhā, who attained the siddhi of mahāmudrā, are complete.
